author: Courtney Kube
description: While Trump often crowdsources from an array of allies, he has tended to make many decisions with just a handful of administration officials.
title: Trump is relying on a small circle of advisers as he weighs Iran strikes

description: NBC Out Reporter Jay Valle joins Meet the Press NOW to share the stories of transgender military members who fear they may not qualify to serve after the Supreme Court allows the Trump administration to implement an effective ban on transgender servicemembers.
title: ‘I still want to serve’: Transgender servicemembers face uncertain future under Trump admin

description: NBC News' Jacob Soboroff spoke to Ls Angeles City Councilmember Eunisses Hernandez as protesters gathered near Dodger Stadium. Hernandez says the L.A. Dodgers did not allow federal agents to enter their stadium.
title: L.A. city councilmember says Dodgers did not allow federal agents on their property

author: Bridget Bowman
description: Some divides are emerging among swing-state Latinos who voted for President Donald Trump when it comes to his approach to mass deportations, according to new focus group conversations with some of these voters, who nevertheless remain broadly supportive of the president.
title: Focus groups: Latino Trump voters diverge on deportations but largely still back the president

author: The Associated Press
description: Newly crowned French Open champion Coco Gauff was stunned on her return to action Thursday, losing to Chinese qualifier Wang Xinyu 6-3, 6-3 at the Berlin Open.
title: Coco Gauff loses in stunning upset in first match since French Open title

author: Nicole Acevedo
description: LOS ANGELES — Dozens of protesters gathered outside of Dodger Stadium on Thursday after federal immigration agents attempted to enter the sports venue Thursday
title: Dodgers block ICE agents from entering stadium in Los Angeles

description: The White House says that President Trump intends to make a decision on action towards Iran within two weeks. NBC News' Vaughn Hillyard reports on the latest in the conflict between Israel and Iran and the questions surrounding the United States' potential involvement.
title: White House says Trump to decide on Iran action within two weeks

author: Sarah Dean
description: White House border czar Tom Homan said Thursday that the Trump administration will continue to conduct immigration raids at worksites, including farms and hotels, but that criminals will be prioritized.
title: Trump's border czar says worksite immigration raids will continue, but that criminals will be prioritized

author: Shaquille Brewster
description: At the Indiana Pacers’ team practice ahead of a crucial Game 6 of the NBA Finals, assistant coach Jenny Boucek was doing everything but focusing on the history she’s been making.
title: Pacers assistant coach Jenny Boucek reflects on making history in NBA Finals

description: In tonight’s special Dateline at 9 p.m. ET, a member of John O’Keefe’s extended family reacts to yesterday’s verdict in the Karen Read trial: “It was definitely not what I was looking for.”
title: Family Member of John O’Keefe Speaks Out to ‘Dateline’ Following Karen Read Verdict

author: Daniel Arkin
description: Zohran Mamdani, a candidate in the Democratic primary for the New York City mayoral election, drew pushback from Jewish organizations and political leaders this week after he appeared to defend the slogan “globalize the intifada.”In an interview with The Bulwark posted Tuesday, Mamdani was asked whether the expression made him uncomfortable.
title: NYC mayoral candidate Zohran Mamdani draws criticism for 'intifada' remarks

author: Sara Monetta
description: Entire neighborhoods in Tehran are emptying out as Israel and Iran exchange barrages of missile and drone strikes.
title: Tehran neighborhoods empty out as Israel and Iran exchange barrages

author: Nicole Acevedo
description: A 9-year-old girl in Florida is recovering from surgery after a shark nearly bit her hand off while she was snorkeling on a beach off Boca Grande last week
title: Florida 9-year-old whose hand was nearly bitten off by shark recalls attack: 'I start screaming'

author: Jo Yurcaba
description: Earlier this month, the Defense Department told transgender service members that they had to choose whether they would voluntarily or involuntarily separate from the military.
title: These trans service members are being forced out of the military due to Trump’s ban

author: Erin Doherty, CNBC
description: President Donald Trump ripped into Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell, calling him “destructive,” after the central bank kept interest rates steady.
title: Trump rips Jerome Powell after Fed holds interest rates steady

author: Kalhan Rosenblatt
description: President Donald Trump has extended the deadline for TikTok’s parent company, ByteDance, to sell the short-form video app to an American owner by another 90 days
title: Trump extends TikTok ban deadline by another 90 days

author: Viola Flowers
description: Ready-to-eat chicken fettuccine Alfredo meals sold at Walmart and Kroger are being voluntarily recalled by manufacturer FreshRealm after a listeria outbreak linked to three deaths.
title: Chicken Alfredo meals at Walmart and Kroger recalled after 3 deaths, 16 hospitalizations

author: The Associated Press
description: Real Madrid forward Kylian Mbappe has been hospitalized with an acute case of gastroenteritis, the Spanish club said Thursday.
title: Real Madrid star Kylian Mbappe hospitalized amid the Club World Cup

author: Daniella Silva
description: For 19-year-old Emerson Colindres, it was supposed to be a routine check-in with Immigration and Customs Enforcement.
title: A teen with no criminal background was deported by ICE, leaving his community aghast

author: Spencer Kimball, CNBC
description: Crude oil futures rose more than 1% on Thursday, after Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu ordered Israel’s military to intensify attacks against Iran.
title: Oil prices rise more than 1% as Israel vows to intensify attacks on Iran

author: Matt Lavietes
description: A federal judge denied Blake Lively's request to keep some of her private text messages with Taylor Swift from Justin Baldoni, marking a major legal victory for the embattled "It Ends with Us" actor and director.
title: Justin Baldoni granted access to Taylor Swift and Blake Lively's private text messages

author: The Associated Press
description: Health Secretary Robert F. Kennedy Jr.’s new vaccine advisers meet next week, but their agenda suggests they’ll skip some expected topics.
title: CDC's vaccine panel to take up longtime target of anti-vaccine groups

author: Chantal Da Silva
description: After Israel launched its war against Iran vowing to take out the country’s nuclear program before it had the ability to produce weapons, fresh scrutiny has fallen on the country's own arsenal
title: What to know about Israel's nuclear weapons program

description: Video captures the moment an Iranian rocket hit Soroka Hospital in Beersheba in southern Israel, forcing an evacuation of patients and spurring a search for survivors. Israel's defense minister calls it a war crime while Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu vows a fierce response. Iran says it was aiming for a military sight near the hospital. NBC’s Richard Engel reports for TODAY.
title: Hospital Patients in Israel Evacuate After Iranian Missile Strike

author: The Associated Press
description: The Stanley Cup is a little banged up, thanks to the Florida Panthers' celebration of back-to-back titles.
title: The Stanley Cup was damaged during Florida Panthers' celebrating their title

author: Elizabeth Robinson
description: Donald Trump weighs how to act in the conflict between Israel and Iran but without his national intelligence director.
title: Trump considers Israel-Iran conflict and Karen Read found not guilty of murder: Morning Rundown

author: Curtis Bunn
description: Samuele Jenkins and Jessica Ivey were arrested days after their son was hit by a car. They were charged with involuntary manslaughter and multiple counts of child abuse.
title: A 7-year-old’s parents were arrested after he was killed by a car. Now they’re speaking out from jail.

author: Alexandra Marquez
description: Sen. Bernie Sanders, I-Vt., on Thursday announced his endorsement of Democrat Rebecca Cooke for Congress in Wisconsin’s 3rd District — making a foray into one of a handful of districts that could decide the next House majority, which President Donald Trump carried by 7 points less than a year ago.“Rebecca is a working class fighter who developed her populist roots in rural Western Wisconsin.
title: Bernie Sanders dives into a key House battleground Trump carried in 2024 with a new endorsement

author: Reuters
description: An anti-Iranian hacking group with possible ties to Israel announced an attack on one of Iran’s largest cryptocurrency exchanges on Wednesday, destroying nearly $90 million and threatening to expose the platform’s source code.
title: Pro-Israel hackers attack Iran's largest crypto exchange, destroying $90 million

author: The Associated Press
description: New Zealand has halted millions of dollars in funding to the Cook Islands over the "breadth and content" of agreements the smaller Pacific nation made with China, the New Zealand Foreign Minister's office said.
title: New Zealand halts millions of funds to Cook Islands over its China ties

author: Andrew Greif
description: In Oklahoma City, fans, city officials and the team itself are intertwined more closely than perhaps any other NBA market.
title: 'Bigger than us': In Oklahoma City, the Thunder and their fans form NBA's closest bond

author: The Associated Press
description: DENVER — A federal judge said Wednesday that prosecutors can proceed with a hate crime charge against a man accused of hurling Molotov cocktails at a group of people demonstrating in Boulder, Colorado, in support of Israeli hostages
title: Judge says hate crime prosecution in Boulder, Colorado, attack can proceed

author: Suzanne Gamboa
description: More than a million people who were granted legal entry to the country under different programs are now being considered illegally here by the Trump administration.
title: As Trump pledges mass deportation, he’s creating more undocumented people

author: Dylan Ebs
description: When New Yorkers fill out ballots in Tuesday’s mayoral primary, they’ll be able to choose more than just one candidate.
title: How ranked choice voting works: A guide ahead of New York City's primary

author: Suzy Khimm
description: Kennedy champions raw milk and criticizes federal health officials for their stance, but he's yet to relax rules or reverse warnings against drinking it.
title: Raw milk advocates wonder: Where is Kennedy?

author: The Associated Press
description: A SpaceX rocket being tested in Texas exploded Wednesday night, sending a dramatic fireball high into the sky
title: SpaceX rocket being tested in Texas explodes, but no injuries reported

description: Soroka hospital in southern Israel was directly hit by an Iranian missile, resulting in "extensive damage" and several injuries.
title: Israeli hospital damaged in Iran missile strike

author: The Associated Press
description: ST. PAUL, Minn. — Hundreds of people, some clutching candles or carrying flowers to lay in front of a memorial, gathered outside Minnesota's Capitol on Wednesday evening for a vigil to remember a prominent state lawmaker and her husband who were gunned down at their home
title: Hundreds gather to remember prominent Minnesota lawmaker and husband slain in their home

author: Laya Neelakandan, CNBC
description: Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi used his first conversation with President Donald Trump since the early May conflict between India and Pakistan to express his frustration with Trump’s repeated claims that he played a significant role in brokering a ceasefire between the two nuclear-armed countries.
title: Modi denies Trump’s claim that he ‘stopped the war’ between India and Pakistan

author: Spencer Kimball, CNBC
description: U.S.
title: U.S. Steel ceases trading on the NYSE as Japan’s Nippon finalizes takeover

author: The Associated Press
description: Two men were sentenced Wednesday to lifelong terms in prison in the shooting death of an 11-year-old boy outside an Albuquerque baseball stadium in 2023 that prompted the New Mexico governor to issue a controversial gun ban.
title: 2 men get life sentences in New Mexico shooting death of 11-year-old that prompted gun ban

author: Alicia Victoria Lozano
description: A new picture of the Salt Lake City protester arrested in a deadly “No Kings” shooting is emerging, and it is different from the one safety volunteers at the event provided to officials.
title: Salt Lake City volunteer's account of deadly shooting questioned after new video emerges

author: Dan De Luce
description: National Intelligence Director Tulsi Gabbard appears to have fallen out of favor with President Donald Trump as he weighs military action against Iran.
title: Tulsi Gabbard sidelined in Trump administration discussions on Israel and Iran

author: The Associated Press
description: Having doubled in strength in less than a day and still expected to grow further, Hurricane Erick on Wednesday chugged through the ideal environment to power up quickly as it approached Mexico’s southern Pacific Coast.
title: Hurricane Erick strengthens to major storm as Mexico's Pacific coast preps for its arrival

author: Maya Huter
description: President Trump’s family business is taking preorders for a gold-colored smartphone, the T1. It's advertised as "Made in the USA," but it's not that easy.
title: This phone is made in the USA, and Trump’s name isn't on it

author: Dan De Luce
description: The U.S. assessment of Iran’s nuclear program has not changed since March when the director of national intelligence said that Tehran has large amounts of enriched uranium but has not made a decision to rush towards building an atomic bomb.
title: Trump and U.S. intelligence appear at odds over Iran's nuclear progress
